intro: Hubera stuhlmannii, commonly known as the Stuhlmann's hubera, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing a compact growth habit with small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits known as cypsela. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
